category_summary: The Polycystic Kidney Disease category includes research on the genetics, mechanisms, diagnosis, and treatment of polycystic kidney disease, a genetic condition that causes fluid filled cysts to grow in the kidneys.

name: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS)
category_summary: The Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS) category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of PCOS, a set of symptoms that can relate to a hormonal imbalance and/or ovarian issues.

name: Post-Acute Sequelae of SARS-CoV-2 infection (PASC) including Long COVID
category_summary: The Post-Acute Sequelae of SARS-CoV-2 infection (PASC) including Long COVID category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of PASC or long COVID, defined as new, returning, or ongoing health conditions or symptoms after the acute phase of SARS-CoV-2 infection has subsided and/or four weeks after infection. This category was formerly known as PASC including Long COVID (renamed in 2023).

name: Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
category_summary: The Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of PTSD, a disorder that some people develop after they experience or see a shocking, scary, or dangerous event.

name: Postural Orthostatic Tachycardia Syndrome
category_summary: The Postural Orthostatic Tachycardia Syndrome category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of postural orthostatic tachycardia syndrome, a condition that affects how your body controls blood flow and blood pressure when you stand up. Includes research on neurogenic orthostatic hypotension.

name: Precision Medicine
category_summary: The Precision Medicine category includes research on the use of biological markers, such as genes or physiological measures, to determine optimal prevention or treatment strategies for improved health outcomes for each individual. All research funded by the All of Us Research Program is reported in the Precision Medicine category.

name: Pregnancy
category_summary: The Pregnancy category includes research on conditions, exposures, treatments, and care during pregnancy, labor, delivery, and childbirth.

name: Prescription Drug Misuse
category_summary: The Prescription Drug Misuse category includes research on the use of prescription drugs in a manner other than prescribed by a provider. Includes research on the prevention, treatment, and outcomes of prescription drug misuse, addiction, and overdose. This category was formerly known as Prescription Drug Abuse (renamed in 2022).

name: Preterm, Low Birth Weight and Health of the Newborn
category_summary: The Preterm, Low Birth Weight and Health of the Newborn category includes research on health conditions affecting the offspring related to prematurity, birth injury or low birth weight that originate during the period of 20 weeks gestation to 1-4 weeks after birth. Includes research on fetal and placental development when focused on prematurity or birth weight. This category was formerly known as Perinatal - Birth - Preterm (LBW) (renamed in 2016).

name: Prevention
category_summary: The Prevention category includes research to (1) identify health risk and protective factors; (2) screen and identify people who are at risk for or have signs of an early stage condition; (3) develop and evaluate interventions that promote health, enhance protective factors, or reduce risk factors; (4) evaluate the impact of policies and regulations designed to promote health and safety; (5) test implementation and dissemination strategies for evidence-based preventive interventions and practices; and (6) develop and evaluate research methods for prevention-focused studies. Includes research on vaccine development; smoking prevention and cessation; and nutrition, physical activity, sleep health, violence, suicide prevention, and risks in the physical and social environment. Research on the treatment, management, or progression of an existing condition is not included, unless the outcome of interest is prevention of a new condition (such as prevention of cardiovascular disease among people living with HIV) or event (such as preventing drug overdose among people with opioid use disorder).
categories_included: Vaccine Related - AIDS,  HPV and/or Cervical Cancer Vaccines,  Malaria Vaccine,  Substance Misuse Prevention,  Suicide Prevention,  Tuberculosis Vaccine,  Youth Violence Prevention

name: Primary Health Care
category_summary: The Primary Health Care category includes research on primary care services, integration of primary health care and specialty care, primary care access and utilization, and improving technologies for use in primary care practice. Includes research on primary health care delivered in community settings or via telehealth.

name: Primary Immunodeficiencies
category_summary: The Primary Immunodeficiencies category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of primary immunodeficiencies or inborn errors of immunity, which are defined as rare, genetic disorders that impair the immune system. Research on cystic fibrosis, somatic mutations, and autoantibodies are not included.

name: Prostate Cancer
category_summary: The Prostate Cancer category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of cancers that originate in tissues of the prostate.

name: Psoriasis
category_summary: The Psoriasis category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of psoriasis, a skin disease causing itchy or sore patches. Includes research on psoriatic arthritis and psoriasiform diseases.

name: Psychosis
category_summary: The Psychosis category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of psychosis, a collection of symptoms that affect the mind and causes a loss of touch with reality. Includes research on psychosis due to substance use, medication, and medical conditions. Includes research on psychosis-related symptoms, such as hallucinations, delusions, perceptual disturbance, self-disturbance, and disordered thinking.

name: Pulmonary Fibrosis
category_summary: The Pulmonary Fibrosis category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of pulmonary fibrosis, a condition causing scarring of lung tissue.

name: Pulmonary Hypertension
category_summary: The Pulmonary Hypertension category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of pulmonary hypertension, a condition that causes high blood pressure in lungs. Includes research on right ventricular heart dysfunction and failure.

name: Racial and Ethnic Minority Health Research
category_summary: The Racial and Ethnic Minority Health Research category includes research on the health of racial and/or ethnic minority groups, as defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Budget (OMB), that can be socially disadvantaged due in part to potential discriminatory acts. The racial and ethnic minority groups defined by OMB are American Indian or Alaska Native, Asian, Black or African American, Hispanic or Latino, Middle Eastern or North African, and Native Hawaiian or Pacific Islander. This category also includes studies of individuals of mixed race or multiple races. Minority health research is the scientific investigation of distinctive health characteristics and attributes of minority racial and/or ethnic groups to understand health outcomes in these populations.

name: Radiation Oncology
category_summary: The Radiation Oncology category includes research on the medical use of radiation technologies as part of cancer treatment to control or destroy cancer cells. Includes research on treatment-related radiation-induced toxicity, injury, or bystander effects.

name: Rare Diseases
category_summary: The Rare Diseases category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of diseases affecting fewer than 200,000 individuals in the United States. These diseases are typically listed on the Genetic and Rare Disease (GARD) and Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results (SEER) Program databases. Includes research on non-rare diseases when there is a focus on a rare subtype or a co-occurring rare disease.
categories_included: Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome,  Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS),  Anthrax,  Ataxia Telangiectasia,  Batten Disease,  Brain Cancer,  Charcot-Marie-Tooth Disease,  Childhood Leukemia,  Congenital Heart Disease,  Cooley's Anemia,   Cystic Fibrosis,  Dystonia,  Esophageal Cancer,  Fragile X Syndrome,  Hepatitis - A,  Huntington's Disease,  Hydrocephalus,  Liver Cancer,  Lymphoma,  Malaria,  Mucopolysaccharidoses (MPS),  Muscular Dystrophy,  Myasthenia Gravis,  Neuroblastoma,  Neurofibromatosis,  Orthopoxviruses,  Osteogenesis Imperfecta,  Ovarian Cancer,  Paget's Disease,  Pancreatic Cancer,  Pediatric Cancer,  Pediatric Cardiomyopathy,  Primary Immunodeficiencies,  Rett Syndrome,  Sickle Cell Disease,  Spina Bifida,  Spinal Muscular Atrophy,  Stomach Cancer,  Sudden Infant Death Syndrome,  Transmissible Spongiform Encephalopathy (TSE),  Tuberculosis,  Tuberous Sclerosis,  Usher Syndrome,  Vaginal Cancer,  Valley Fever,  West Nile Virus, Orphan Drug

name: Recovery Support Services
category_summary: The Recovery Support Services category includes research on the services to support, augment, or encourage the process of change through which individuals improve their health and wellness by addressing substance use disorder in addition to or in lieu of standard clinical care. Includes research on services to help people enter and navigate systems of care, remove barriers to recovery, and stay engaged in the recovery process. Research on medical services (such as provided by healthcare professionals) and clinical treatments (such as withdrawal management) is not included.

name: Regenerative Medicine
category_summary: The Regenerative Medicine category includes research that seeks to develop functional cells, cell components, tissues, and organ substitutes for repair, replacement, or enhancement of biological function that has been lost due to abnormalities present at birth, injury, disease, or aging. Includes research on natural regeneration and tissue regenerated outside of the body for subsequent implantation.

name: Rehabilitation
category_summary: The Rehabilitation category includes research with a goal of improved functional ability whether mental, physical, or emotional, such as treatments for diseases or conditions, devices used for rehabilitation, and interventions delivered by a rehabilitation professional. Regenerative medicine research is included when an intervention is used to assist the regeneration of cells or tissues. Criminal rehabilitation research is not included.

name: Rett Syndrome
category_summary: The Rett Syndrome category includes research on the genetics, diagnosis, and treatment of the neurodevelopmental disorder Rett syndrome.

name: Rheumatoid Arthritis
category_summary: The Rheumatoid Arthritis category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of rheumatoid arthritis, a disease that causes pain, swelling, stiffness and loss of function in joints.

name: Rural Health
category_summary: The Rural Health category includes research on the health of rural populations and rural areas within the United States. Rural areas are defined by the Health Resources and Services Administration.

name: Sarcoidosis
category_summary: The Sarcoidosis category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of sarcoidosis, a condition that develops when groups of cells in the immune system form red and swollen lumps.

name: Sarcopenia
category_summary: The Sarcopenia category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of sarcopenia, a loss of muscle mass and function due to aging.

name: Schizophrenia
category_summary: The Schizophrenia category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of schizophrenia spectrum disorders, which are mental disorders characterized by disruptions in thought processes, perceptions, emotional responsiveness, and social interactions. Includes research involving clinical high-risk individuals and first episode psychosis.

name: Scleroderma
category_summary: The Scleroderma category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of localized and systemic scleroderma, an autoimmune disease that causes inflammation and thickening in the skin and other areas of the body.

name: Screening and Brief Intervention for Substance Misuse
category_summary: The Screening and Brief Intervention for Substance Misuse category includes research on therapies to quickly screen for substance-related disorders and the immediate, brief intervention for the screened condition. This category was formerly known as Screening and Brief Intervention for Substance Abuse (renamed in 2022).

name: Sepsis
category_summary: The Sepsis category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of blood infections that lead to sepsis, a life-threatening immune response to infection. Includes research on septic shock. This category was formerly known as Septicemia (renamed in 2018).

name: Serious Mental Illness
category_summary: The Serious Mental Illness category includes research on diagnosable mental, behavioral, or emotional disorders that result in a substantial functional impairment that limits major life activities (for example, eating, personal hygiene, managing money, taking medication as prescribed, and functioning in social contexts).

name: Sexually Transmitted Infections
category_summary: The Sexually Transmitted Infections category includes research on the causes, transmission, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of sexually transmitted infections. Includes research on high-risk sexual behaviors that lead to transmission. This category was formerly known as Sexually Transmitted Diseases/Herpes (renamed in 2018).

name: Sickle Cell Disease
category_summary: The Sickle Cell Disease category includes research on the genetics, diagnosis, and treatment of sickle cell disease, a group of inherited red blood cell disorders. Includes research on iron overload and acute chest syndrome.

name: Skin Cancer
category_summary: The Skin Cancer category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of cancers that originate in the tissue of the skin.

name: Sleep Research
category_summary: The Sleep Research category includes research on sleep and the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of aberrant sleep-related conditions. Includes research on hormones regulating sleep, wakefulness studies, and sleep-specific circadian rhythms.

name: Social Determinants of Health
category_summary: The Social Determinants of Health category includes research on individual and structural social determinants of health which can lead to greater understanding, design, and implementation of effective interventions to reduce health disparities.

name: Spina Bifida
category_summary: The Spina Bifida category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of spina bifida, a birth disorder that involves the incomplete development of the spine. Includes research on the related birth defect, anencephaly.

name: Spinal Cord Injury
category_summary: The Spinal Cord Injury category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of acquired injuries to spinal cord from an outside force.

name: Spinal Muscular Atrophy
category_summary: The Spinal Muscular Atrophy category includes research on the genetics, diagnosis, and treatment of spinal muscular atrophy, a genetic, motor neuron disease characterized by wasting of the skeletal muscles.

name: Stem Cell Research
category_summary: Reporting for Stem Cell Research does not follow the standard RCDC process. The Stem Cell Research category is created by manual classification of projects determined by NIH subject matter experts as relating to the use and study of stem cells. This category includes the narrow Stem Cell Research categories (human and non-human) related to embryonic, induced pluripotent, nonembryonic, and umbilical cord blood/placenta stem cells.

name: Stimulant Use and Misuse
category_summary: The Stimulant Use and Misuse category includes research on the prevention, treatment and outcomes of stimulant use, misuse, addiction, and overdose. Includes only research on stimulants with addiction-forming potential, such as methamphetamine, cocaine, amphetamine, methylphenidate, and cathinone.

name: Stomach Cancer
category_summary: The Stomach Cancer category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of cancers that originate in tissues lining the stomach.

name: Stroke
category_summary: The Stroke category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of stroke, a brain attack that occurs when a blood clot or leaking or burst blood vessel cuts off blood flow to part of the brain.

name: Substance Misuse
category_summary: The Substance Misuse category includes research on the misuse of licit and illicit addictive substances as it relates to dependence and tolerance, including the prevention, treatment, and outcomes of use. Research on substances without addiction forming potential or do not cause dependence (such as acetaminophen, blood pressure medications) is not included. Tobacco and e-cigarette research is included when focused on the trajectories, patterns, cessation, and dependence of use. All research funded by the National Institute on Drug Abuse and the National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism is reported in the Substance Misuse category. This category includes all spending reported under the Drug Abuse (NIDA Only) category as well as projects categorized under the broader area of Substance Misuse. More information on this area is available at https://nida.nih.gov/research-topics. This category was formerly known as Substance Abuse (renamed in 2021).
categories_included: Alcoholism, Alcohol Use and Health,  Cocaine,  Drug Abuse (NIDA only),  Methamphetamine,  Opioid Misuse and Addiction,  Prescription Drug Misuse,  Screening and Brief Intervention for Substance Misuse, Harm Reduction for Substance Misuse,  Recovery Support Services,  Substance Misuse Prevention

name: Substance Misuse Prevention
category_summary: The Substance Misuse Prevention category includes research on prevention of substance use disorders (SUD) and the escalation of recreational/occasional use to SUD. This category was formerly known as Substance Abuse Prevention (renamed in 2022).

name: Sudden Infant Death Syndrome
category_summary: The Sudden Infant Death Syndrome category includes research on the causes and prevention of sudden death in infants from birth to one year, when no other cause of death can be identified.

name: Suicide
category_summary: The Suicide category includes research on the causes, risks, and prevention of suicide. Research on mental health conditions such as depression is only included when focused on suicide or suicidality.

name: Suicide Prevention
category_summary: The Suicide Prevention category includes research on interventions to prevent suicide and reduce suicide risk.

name: Teenage Pregnancy
category_summary: The Teenage Pregnancy category includes research on pregnancy in adolescents from ages 12-20. Includes research on the mental health of teenage parents, adolescent sexual risk behavior, and promotion of safe sex practices among adolescents.

name: Telehealth
category_summary: The Telehealth category includes research on the use of digital information and communication technologies by healthcare providers to deliver remote healthcare services. Includes research involving patient-provider interactions as well as provider-provider interactions.

name: Temporomandibular Muscle/Joint Disorder (TMJD)
category_summary: The Temporomandibular Muscle/Joint Disorder (TMJD) category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of pain and dysfunction in the jaw joint and muscles.

name: Therapeutic Cannabinoid Research
category_summary: The Therapeutic Cannabinoid Research category includes research on cannabis, purified or synthetic cannabinoids, and the endogenous cannabinoid system for medical uses, such as treatment of diseases or conditions.

name: Tickborne Diseases
category_summary: The Tickborne Diseases category includes research on the causative pathogens, transmission, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of diseases in humans caused by tickborne infections.

name: Tobacco
category_summary: The Tobacco category includes research on combustible and non-combustible tobacco products and the health effects of tobacco use, including the prevention, treatment, and outcomes of use and addiction.
categories_included: Electronic Nicotine Delivery Systems,  Tobacco Smoke and Health

name: Tobacco Smoke and Health
category_summary: The Tobacco Smoke and Health category includes research on combustible tobacco products and the health effects of combustible tobacco smoking, including the prevention, treatment, and outcomes of use. This category was formerly known as Smoking and Health (renamed in 2018).

name: Topical Microbicides
category_summary: The Topical Microbicides category includes research on the development and evaluation of products designed for intravaginal and/or rectal use to prevent sexually transmitted infections, including HIV infection.

name: Tourette Syndrome
category_summary: The Tourette Syndrome category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of the neurological disorder Tourette syndrome and other tic disorders. Includes research on behavioral manifestations of these disorders, such as echolalia, coprolalia, and palinphrasia.

name: Transmissible Spongiform Encephalopathy (TSE)
category_summary: The Transmissible Spongiform Encephalopathy (TSE) category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of transmissible spongiform encephalopathies or prion diseases, a group of rare degenerative brain disorders characterized by tiny holes that give the brain a "spongy" appearance. Includes research on prion biology.

name: Transplantation
category_summary: The Transplantation category includes research on the transfer of a solid organ, cells, tissues, or bone marrow, including research on the health of transplant recipients.
categories_included: Human Fetal Tissue Transplantation,  Organ Transplantation

name: Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI)
category_summary: The Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI) category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of acquired injuries to the brain from an outside force. This category was formerly known as Injury - Traumatic Brain Injury (renamed in 2021).

name: Traumatic Head and Spine Injury
category_summary: The Traumatic Head and Spine Injury category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of acquired injuries to the spine or head from an outside force. This category was formerly known as Injury - Trauma - (Head and Spine) (renamed in 2021).
categories_included: Spinal Cord Injury,  Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI)

name: Tuberculosis
category_summary: The Tuberculosis category includes research on the causative pathogens, transmission, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of the bacterial disease tuberculosis.

name: Tuberculosis Vaccine
category_summary: The Tuberculosis Vaccine category includes research on the development, delivery, and outcomes of tuberculosis vaccines.

name: Tuberous Sclerosis
category_summary: The Tuberous Sclerosis category includes research on the genetics, diagnosis, and treatment of tuberous sclerosis, a genetic condition characterized by seizures, mental disabilities, and skin and eye lesions.

name: Underage Drinking
category_summary: The Underage Drinking category includes research on alcohol consumption by individuals under the age 21.

name: Unintentional Childhood Injury
category_summary: The Unintentional Childhood Injury category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of unintentional physical injuries occurring during the fetal period to age 21. This category was formerly known as Injury - Unintentional Childhood Injury (renamed in 2021).

name: Urologic Diseases
category_summary: The Urologic Diseases category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of diseases and conditions that affect the urinary tract and male genital tract.

name: Usher Syndrome
category_summary: The Usher Syndrome category includes research on the genetics, diagnosis, and treatment of Usher syndrome, a genetic condition affecting vision, hearing, and balance.

name: Uterine Cancer
category_summary: The Uterine Cancer category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of cancers that originate in the endometrium and body of the uterus.

name: Vaccine Related
category_summary: The Vaccine Related category includes research on the development, delivery, outcomes, and societal factors of vaccines and active immunization (activation of the immune system after exposure to an antigen).
categories_included: Coronaviruses Vaccines,  Vaccine Related - AIDS,  HPV and/or Cervical Cancer Vaccines,  Malaria Vaccine,  Tuberculosis Vaccine

name: Vaccine Related - AIDS
category_summary: Reporting for Vaccine Related - AIDS does not follow the standard RCDC process. The Vaccine Related - AIDS category is created by manual classification of projects determined by NIH subject matter experts as vaccine related AIDS research within the HIV/AIDS category.

name: Vaginal Cancer
category_summary: The Vaginal Cancer category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of cancers that originate in the tissue of the vagina.

name: Valley Fever
category_summary: The Valley Fever category includes research on the causative pathogen, transmission, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of the Valley fever or coccidioidomycosis, an infection caused by the fungus Coccidioides.

name: Vascular Contributions to Cognitive Impairment and Dementia (VCID)
category_summary: The Vascular Contributions to Cognitive Impairment and Dementia (VCID) category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention and treatment of memory impairment and other cognitive dysfunction due to vascular disease or injury in the brain. This category was formerly known as Vascular Cognitive Impairment/Dementia (renamed in 2023).

name: Vector-Borne Diseases
category_summary: The Vector-Borne Diseases category includes research on the causative pathogens, transmission, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of infections and diseases that are transmitted by vectors, such as mosquitoes, ticks, and fleas that carry microbes infectious to humans.
categories_included: Malaria,  Tickborne Diseases,  West Nile Virus,  Zika Virus

name: Violence Against Women
category_summary: The Violence Against Women category includes research on the causes, prevention, and outcomes of physical and psychological violence directed toward women of any age.

name: Violence Research
category_summary: The Violence Research category includes research on the causes, prevention, and outcomes of physical and psychological violence, including self-directed violence.
categories_included: Child Abuse and Neglect Research,  Homicide and Legal Interventions, Violence Against Women,  Youth Violence

name: Vulvodynia
category_summary: The Vulvodynia category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of vulvodynia, a chronic pain condition in the vulva.

name: West Nile Virus
category_summary: The West Nile Virus category includes research on the causative pathogen, transmission, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of infections caused by West Nile virus.

name: Women's Health Research
category_summary: The Women's Health Research category includes research on health conditions affecting women across the lifespan including female-specific conditions or issues that may present differently or disproportionately in women. Pregnancy and breastfeeding research is included when the focus of the research is maternal health.
categories_included: Breast Cancer,  Cervical Cancer,  Endometriosis,  Fibroid Tumors (Uterine),  Maternal Health,  Menopause,  Ovarian Cancer,  Pelvic Inflammatory Disease,  Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS),  Rett Syndrome,  Uterine Cancer,  Vaginal Cancer,  Violence Against Women,  Vulvodynia

name: Wound Healing and Care
category_summary: The Wound Healing and Care category includes research on the causes, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of all external wounds, which includes acute wounds (such as abrasions, lacerations, skin tears, blisters, burns, and penetrating trauma wounds) and chronic wounds (such as diabetic, venous, and pressure ulcers). Includes research on skin, eye, and oral wounds. Research on internal wounds, such as those sustained to organs, bones, and muscles, are not included.

name: Youth Violence
category_summary: The Youth Violence category includes research on the causes, prevention, and outcomes of physical and psychological violence by youth against other youths (birth to age 21), including hazing and bullying.

name: Youth Violence Prevention
category_summary: The Youth Violence Prevention category includes research on the prevention or reduction of physical and psychological violence by youth against other youths (birth to age 21), including hazing and bullying.

name: Zika Virus
category_summary: The Zika Virus category includes research on the causative pathogen, transmission, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of infections caused by Zika virus.
